H0.text: Its kinetic energy is increasing is true of a car that is accelerating along a horizontal roadway.

H1.text: Its kinetic energy is decreasing is the true statement about a car accelerating along a horizontal roadway.

H2.text: Its potential energy is increasing is true of a car that is accelerating along a horizontal roadway.

H3.text: Its potential energy is decreasing for a car accelerating along a horizontal roadway.

A4.text: As a consequence of this quadrupling, it takes four times the work to double the speed.

A5.text: The kinetic energy of an object is related to its momentum by the equation: E_k = p^2/(2m).
